wikipedia_page.main: Stan Rowlands was a football player. He was a forward for Tranmere Rovers and scored 32 goals for Tranmere during the 1913/14 season, helping them to with the Lancashire Combination. In the same season, on 16 March 1914, Rowlands represented Wales in their 2–0 defeat to England; this was the first time a Tranmere player had played for their national team.
